intro: Impatiens celebica, commonly known as the Celebes impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
